Flex Co-Pilot and Voice Intelligence Operator Results are delayed. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. This is related to an OpenAI outage experienced globally. We have detected an issue with outbound WhatsApp messages failing with error 500. This is also affecting Flex and Verify. This is impacting outbound WhatsApp tasks which will be created but will have a delay in message sent to customer. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: SuperSim and Programmable Wireless Degradation

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing the issue with the billing pipeline. Super SIM UI customers are getting accessed without any delays. There is no delay for usage and billing reports. Programmable Wireless customers are not facing delays while provisioning activities. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery in the issue with the billing pipeline. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still experiencing the issue with the billing pipeline. The bug in software caused the billing information to be delayed on the UI and API. The team is still working to identify the issue. We will post the update in the next 2 hours or sooner if more information will become available.
We are still investigating the issue. We will provide further updates as and when we get more information about this.

Impacted Services: Access to Super SIM UI and delays with usage and billing reporting and Programmable Wireless Provisioning
Start: Wednesday, December 11, 2024 05:30 UTC / Wednesday, December 11, 2024 00:30 EST (UTC-5)
Beginning at 05:30 UTC, customers will experience issues as indicated below:
For Super SIM: Customers will face issues accessing the Super SIM UI accessing via console.korewireless.com, and experience delays with usage and billing reporting
For Programmable Wireless customers may encounter delays in provisioning activities

incidents.name: Inaccurate Portability API Responses

incident_updates.body: Twilio Portability API Responses was degraded between between 10:00 and 6:30 Pacific Time on 12/04/2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced incorrect portability responses indicating that a number was not portable to Twilio. The issue has now been resolved.

The portability API was degraded between 10:00 and 6:30 Pacific Time on 12/04/2024. During this period of time, the API may have returned incorrect portability responses indicating that a number was not portable to Twilio. The not portable reason code would have been 22130. The issue has now been resolved, please retry your request if you believe your phone number should have been portable.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with call dip service from portability-api. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

We are observing recovery in SMS delivery failures to Sberbank Telecom Network in Russia via a subset of Alphanumeric Sender ID. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to experience SMS delivery failures to Sberbank Telecom Network in Russia via a subset of Alphanumeric Sender ID. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing SMS delivery failures to Sberbank Telecom Network in Russia via a subset of Alphanumeric Sender ID. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
